snippet: Shutting schools doesn’t assure safety from Ebola. It damages chances for a nation’s recovery.
abstract: Op-Ed article by former refugee Chernor Bah warns that devastation unleashed by Ebola in Sierra Leone is not just health emergency but tragedy that has swept away fragile roots of new society that emerged after country's civil war; says that most damaging effect of Ebola may be its gutting of nation's school system.
lead_paragraph: Shutting schools doesn’t assure safety from Ebola. It damages chances for a nation’s recovery.

headline.main: Ebola and the Lost Children of Sierra Leone
